Reason2: Based on calculations against Google's total Scope 3 emissions (10,812,000 tCO2e in 2023), several categories are clearly significant (>5%): Purchased goods and services (37.3%), Capital goods (14.8%), Fuel- and energy-related activities (11.0%), and Upstream transportation (5.4%) (Page 32).
Reason3: The report aggregates 'Category 2 (Capital goods), Category 11 (Use of sold products), and Category 12 (End-of-life treatment of sold products)' into an 'Other categories' subtotal (Page 71). This aggregation hinders explicit identification of all *individual* significant categories as required by the metric.
